intro: Oncostemum nervosum f. typicum, commonly known as the narrow-veined oncostemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
